args.natural_language_statement: Suppose f : [a,b] → ℝ is bounded and uniformly continuous. Prove f is Riemann integrable.

retrieved_examples.nl: If f : [a,b] → ℝ is continuous then f is Riemann integrable.
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem continuous_on.interval_integrable {a b : ℝ} (f : ℝ → ℝ) (h : ContinuousOn f (Icc a b)) : IntervalIntegrable f volume a b := by sorry

retrieved_examples.nl: A bounded uniformly continuous function on ℝ is integrable on any closed interval.
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem uniform_continuous_on.interval_integrable {a b : ℝ} (f : ℝ → ℝ) (h_unif : UniformContinuousOn f (Icc a b)) (h_bdd : Bounded (range (fun x => f x) (Icc a b))) : IntervalIntegrable f volume a b := by sorry

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open scoped Uniformity Topology
open Filter Set Metric Function

/-- Suppose f : [a,b] → ℝ is bounded and uniformly continuous. Prove f is Riemann integrable. -/
theorem riemannIntegrable_of_uniform_continuity_on_Icc {a b : ℝ} {f : ℝ → ℝ} :
    UniformContinuousOn f (Icc a b) → BddAbove (range f) → BddBelow (range f) →
      IntervalIntegrable f volume a b := sorry"}

args.content:
import Mathlib
open scoped Uniformity Topology
open Filter Set Metric Function

/-- Suppose f : [a,b] → ℝ is bounded and uniformly continuous. Prove f is Riemann integrable. -/
theorem riemannIntegrable_of_uniform_continuity_on_Icc {a b : ℝ} {f : ℝ → ℝ} :
    UniformContinuousOn f (Icc a b) → BddAbove (range f) → BddBelow (range f) →
      IntervalIntegrable f volume a b := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Suppose f : [a,b] → ℝ is bounded and uniformly continuous. Then f is Riemann (interval) integrable. -/
theorem riemann_integrable_of_uniform_continuous_on_Icc {a b : ℝ} {f : ℝ → ℝ} :
  UniformContinuousOn f (Icc a b) → BddAbove (range f) → BddBelow (range f) →
  IntervalIntegrable f volume a b := by sorry

/-- Suppose f : [a,b] → ℝ is bounded and uniformly continuous. Then f is Riemann (interval) integrable. -/

  UniformContinuousOn f (Icc a b) → BddAbove (range f) → BddBelow (range f) →
  IntervalIntegrable f MeasureTheory.volume a b := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Suppose f : [a,b] → ℝ is bounded and uniformly continuous on [a,b]. Then f is Riemann (interval) integrable. -/
theorem riemann_integrable_of_uniform_continuous_on_Icc {a b : ℝ} {f : ℝ → ℝ} :
  UniformContinuousOn f (Icc a b) → BddAbove (f '' Icc a b) → BddBelow (f '' Icc a b) →
  IntervalIntegrable f MeasureTheory.volume a b := by sorry
